entries.title: Company to Package Plastic Waste into a New Generation of Building Materials
entries.description: A recycling technician checks pressed plastic bottles at a recycling plant in Santiago, on Aug. 21, 2019. (Martin Bernetti/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Scotiabank to Close Accounts of Diagolon Founder Jeremy MacKenzie, Bans Him From Branches
entries.description: Jeremy MacKenzie (R) talks with an unidentified woman outside the venue where former child soldier Omar Khadr is speaking, in Halifax on Feb. 10, 2020. (The Canadian Press/Andrew Vaughan)

entries.title: Remote Labrador Location Potential Training Ground for Astronauts
entries.description: Discovery Hill near the Mistastin crater in Labrador is shown in a handout photo. (The Canadian Press/HO-Gordon Osinski)

entries.title: Federal Cabinet Set for Three-Day Retreat in Hamilton Ahead of Parliament’s Return
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks in Windsor, Ont., on Jan. 17, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Nicole Osborne)

entries.title: Second Officer Dies in Hospital After Avalanche Near Kaslo, BC
entries.description: Backcountry skiers are dwarfed by the mountains as they make their way along a mountain ridge near McGillivray Pass Lodge located in the southern Chilcotin Mountains of British Columbia, Jan. 10, 2012. (The Canadian Press/Jonathan Hayward)

entries.title: Feds Settle Residential School Day Student Class-Action Lawsuit for $2.8 Billion
entries.description: Indigenous Services Minister Marc Miller responds to a question during a news conference on February 4, 2021 in Ottawa. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Anthony Furey: Canada Adds Bureaucracy to the Commercial Space Race
entries.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carrying the company's Crew Dragon spacecraft is launched at NASA's Kennedy Space Centre, in Cape Canaveral, Florida, on Oct. 5, 2022. (Joel Kowsky/NASA via Getty Images)

entries.title: Rex Murphy: No Surprise the ‘Squeamish Inquisition’ Wants to Stop Peterson’s Ottawa Talk
entries.description: Jordan Peterson talks on stage at the Honda Center in Anaheim, Calif., on Nov. 3, 2022. (Carol Cassis/The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Washington to Designate Russian Private Military Group Wagner as ‘Transnational Criminal Organization’
entries.description: Visitors wearing military camouflage stand at the entrance of the "PMC Wagner Centre," associated with the founder of the Wagner private military group (PMC) Yevgeny Prigozhin, during the official opening of the office block on the National Unity Day, in St. Petersburg, on Nov. 4, 2022. (Olga Maltseva/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Labour Reports Boris Johnson for Alleged Conflict of Interest
entries.description: Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson makes a resignation statement in front of 10 Downing Street in central London on July 7, 2022. (Niklas Halle'n/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: NS Needs to Double Number of Residency Spots for Med School to Slash Wait Times: Medical Association President
entries.description: Ambulances outside the Dartmouth General Hospital in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, in a file photo. (The Canadian Press/Andrew Vaughan)

entries.title: Blast Claimed by Separatist Group Derails Train in Southwest Pakistan
entries.description: Detailed train carriages in Balochistan, Pakistan, on Jan. 20, 2023, in a still from video. (Medical Emergency Response Centers 1122 Balochistan Handout via Reuters/Screenshot via The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Brazil Police Raid Governor’s House Over Capital Riots
entries.description: Supporters of Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro demonstrate against President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva as security forces operate, outside Brazil’s National Congress in Brasilia, Brazil, on Jan. 8, 2023. (Adriano Machado/Reuters)

entries.title: Turkey Condemns Sweden Protests, Cancels Ministers’ Meeting
entries.description: Leader of Danish political party Stram Kurs, Rasmus Paludan, stands outside the Turkish embassy in Stockholm, Sweden, on Jan. 21, 2023. (Fredrik Sandberg/TT News Agency via AP)

entries.title: US Military Says Somalia Strike Killed 30 al-Shabaab Terrorists
entries.description: Somali security officers drive past a section of Hotel Hayat, the scene of an al-Shabaab group terrorist attack in Mogadishu, Somalia, on Aug. 20, 2022. (Feisal Omar/Reuters)

entries.title: Romanian Judge Grants 30-day Extension of Tate Detention
entries.description: Andrew Tate leaves the Court of Appeal in Bucharest, Romania, on Jan. 10, 2023. (Alexandru Dobre/AP Photo)

entries.title: Prominent Quebec Cardinal Marc Ouellet Denies Second Allegation of Sexual Misconduct
entries.description: FILE - Canadian Cardinal Marc Ouellet attends a Mass for the election of a new pope celebrated by Cardinal Angelo Sodano, not pictured, inside St. Peter's Basilica, at the Vatican, Mar. 12, 2013. (The Canadian Press/AP-Andrew Medichini)

entries.title: François Legault Accuses Justin Trudeau of Attacking Quebec’s Democracy and People
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Quebec Premier Francois Legault chat while walking to a meeting in Montreal, on Dec. 20, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Paul Chiasson)

entries.title: Peru Arrests 200 in Lima; Machu Picchu Ordered Closed as Protests Flare
entries.description: Protesters clash with the police in Lima, Peru, on Jan. 21, 2023. (Sebastian Castaneda/Reuters)

entries.title: New Zealand Lawmakers Confirm Hipkins as Jacinda Ardern’s Replacement: Media
entries.description: Chris Hipkins speaks to members of the media, after being confirmed as the only nomination to replace Jacinda Ardern as leader of the Labour Party, outside New Zealand's parliament in Wellington, New Zealand on Jan. 21, 2023. (Lucy Craymer/Reuters)

entries.title: Russia’s Wagner Chief Writes to White House Over New US Sanctions
entries.description: An interior view of PMC Wagner Centre, which is a project implemented by the businessman and founder of the Wagner private military group Yevgeny Prigozhin, during the official opening of the office block in Saint Petersburg, Russia, on Nov. 4, 2022. (Igor Russak/Reuters)

entries.title: Study Finds Higher Mortality Risk for 18 Months Following COVID Infection
entries.description: Health workers in PPE take a patient from an ambulance in London, UK, on April 10, 2020. (Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)
